awd_titl_txt: Research Initiation:  Resonance Suppression Design by       Moving Boundary and Eigenvalue Placement
awd_abstract_narration: This research focuses on resonance suppression design in flexible               mechanical systems. Specifically, the research will investigate                 the feasibility of including solid supports to vibration                        structures to provide damping and additional stiffness under                    large  amplitude vibration conditions. To design such a system                  requires apriori establishment of analytical relations                          between system geometry and eigenvalues as governed by moving                   boundary partial differential equations. This will                              be done during the course of the mathematical modeling and                      computer simulation effort. The results are expected to provide                 guidelines for using solid supports and adjusting design                        variables for eigenvalue placement as well as extending knowledge               of non self adjoint partial differential operators *** //
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
